ext_descriptions.ext_description: A cylindrical_pair_value is a type of . A cylindrical_pair_value specifies the set of pair parameters for a .

the
to which the cylindrical_pair_value applies.
the translation value.
the angle of rotation.

A gear_pair_value is a type of . A gear_pair_value specifies the pair parameters for the .
If the gear pair is part of a more complex gear mechanism, the gear pair values as defined here may not be the primary design targets. In the case of a planetary gear mechanism, for example, it is more important to know the rotation angles of the planetary gears with respect to an inertial coordinate system than the rotation angles between the planetary gears and the frames which support them. See [2] for a detailed description of this specific example.
For a given configuration of pairs within a mechanism, the more global motion parameters can be derived, in general, from the individual pair parameters and vice versa. This is not possible, however, generically without knowledge of the configuration. Therefore, the specification of functions which provide such derivations is left to an application protocol for which these derivations are required.

the
to which the gear_pair_value applies.
the value of the pair parameter of the first link.
the value of the pair parameter of the second link.

An initial_state is a specification of initial values of the pair parameters of a .
Some types of kinematic structures, such as four bar linkages, can only be assembled uniquely if configuration information is provided in addition to shape parameters, such as link lengths. In those cases the initial_state provides enough pair parameter information to make the configuration unique.

the
to which the initial_state applies.
the pair parameter values of each pair in the .

An initial_state shall provide in its set of pair_values exactly one pair value for each
in the
to which it applies.

A pair_value is a type of
that is a configuration of the two links that join a . Each pair_value is either a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , a , an , a , an , a , or a .

the
to which the pair_value applies.

the
to which the planar_pair_value applies.
the value of the angle of rotation for a .
the value of translation in x-direction for a .
the value of translation in y-direction for a .

the
to which the point_on_planar_curve_pair_value applies.
the positional value for the point on the curve.

the input specification of the rotational pair parameter values from which the actual_orientation is derived. An input_orientation is either a
or a .

the array of rotational pair parameter values for a
according to the ypr notation. This is derived from input_orientation by the function .

The actual_point_on_curve shall be defined as a point on the
of the
referenced by applies_to_pair.

A rolling_surface_pair_value is a type of . A rolling_surface_pair_value specifies the set of pair parameters for the .

the
to which the rolling_surface_pair_value applies.
the contact point of the contact surface () of the first link.
the angle required to rotate the xcp-direction of the first link surface around the zc-direction of that surface until it coincides with the xc-direction of the second link surface.

The actual_point_on_surface shall be defined as a point on
of the
referenced by applies_to_pair.

An unconstrained_pair_value is a type of . An unconstrained_pair_value specifies the pair parameters for an .
